WRITING.TEXT: I made a silly CoCo deck on Cockatrice a while ago that isn't too far off from this, using [[Skaab Ruinator]] , [[Rhox War Monk]] , [[Woolly Thoctar]] , etc. I had no idea about that [[Pillar of the Paruns]] card, first time seeing it. I'm obviously not the first person to think of it though. Maybe Spell Queller pushed the deck into some sort of viability.
Because of cards like Skull Clamp and Mental Misstep, is it fair to say that no-banlist modern is almost as powerful as some Legacy decks?
Man those cards take me back, those were the days.

This, and several other aspects of the video are so weird that it almost makes me think it's fake. I don't think it is, I believe it's real. But there is so much odd behavior that I can't wrap my head around.

It's definitely a cool set. Certainly flavor-wise one of, if not the greatest ever. So naturally you want it to be good functionally as well, but in a lot of cases it didn't quite get there in Standard, and definitely doesn't get there in other formats.

WRITING.TITLE: Youtube user Boogie about to open Eternal Masters box on Twitch.

WRITING.TEXT: I lol'd immediately.
I don't really like/support alters generally, but these are the best I've ever seen.

The original series is the best to me. I think people who have trouble watching it find it "boring". To quantify boring, it's slow, mostly dialogue driven, and cerebral. To me though, the fact that the show takes it's time is what allows it to be intense. This may be an odd comparison, but take Tarantino movies. If his dialogue doesn't "do it" for you, then you are NOT going to like his movies. Kind of the same with TOS. I liken the original series to the Twilight Zone. That is, many of the episodes could be movies. Most of them have something to say, or some question to ask about life. With both shows, the episodes transcend their genre, which to me is something the best sci-fi works accomplish. Because the show is able to do this, that is, because the episodes aren't really about science fiction, lasers, aliens, etc., I could care less about old school special effects and cheesy/goofy moments.
I don't like alters, but the Silver Surfer Crucible of Worlds fits so well.

Players and permanents can do things, even if permanents say they can't.
I don't know how long it has been producing cards, so my main question for cube is: are there are enough playable ones? If so then yeah, it would be a hoot.
Agreed. I hate sports but it's just fun listening to their banter on any subject.

This is my favorite and I don't even play Vintage. The depth that they talk about things and how thorough and professional they go about it is just fascinating to me. While they don't make a new episode every week, when they do make one it's HUGE and great when going for a long drive.
There are many times when Flores talks and I can't hear anything while I am driving, but at least I can consistently hear Chapin, if his internet isn't screwed.
